abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL)
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory. The
            SAL's main contribution has been to help Pakistan
            implement a strong program of reforms. As a result, the
            Paris and London Club creditors agreed to reschedule
            Pakistan's debt service, providing the Government with
            much-needed breathing space. The SAL thus helped Pakistan
            stabilize its macroeconomic position and strengthen its
            external position. Several lessons have been drawn from this
            project. By strengthening governance and deepening the
            reforms in the banking and power sectors, the project has
            helped Pakistan focus on its medium-term reform program to
            improve human development and build a competitive
            environment for private sector development and sustainable
            growth. They include: 1) A series of quick-disbursing
            single-tranche adjustment operations is an effective tool
            for managing risks. 2) Close coordination with other
            international financial institutions can benefit borrowers.
            3) Adjustment operations can be implemented rapidly when the
            client has a clear vision and a strong sense of ownership of
            the reform program. 4) Strong field presence greatly
            facilitated dialogue and response.
